Description: TEI is a foundational tool in the digital humanities. It provides a standardized and structured approach to encoding textual data, enabling researchers to digitally work with, analyze, and preserve textual materials. This DH tool enhances the accessibility and analytical capabilities of humanities scholars, making it an essential tool in this field while facilitating collaboration among diverse institutions and researchers.
This tool can help modulate details about events and monuments into 3D environments by adding metadata
Area of Use: Virtual Reality, History and Timeline Creation
Abstract Name: The Scholarly 3D Toolkit: Annotation, Publication, and Analysis of 3D Scenes alongside Imported Humanities Data

Description: WordPress as a framework for other digital work such as web interaction, data extraction, and delivering structured data to a variety of data-analysis-based systems. Abstract Name: WordPress as a framework for automated data capture, filtering and structuring processes. The new order of the authors
